title.rendered: Hard Rock International Joins World Wildlife Fund to Go Dark for Earth Hour 2024

content.rendered:
Hard Rock Cafes, Casinos and Hotels Across the World to Participate in Annual Global Call-to-Action to Conserve Energy to Protect the Planet 

HOLLYWOOD, Fla., March 20, 2024 /PRNewswire/ — For the sixth consecutive year, Hard Rock International is joining forces with World Wildlife Fund (WWF), one of the world’s leading conservation organizations, for the annual Earth Hour movement, in support of the brand’s “Save the Planet” motto and program. Since 2007, WWF has encouraged landmarks and businesses around the world to switch off lights as a symbolic action, driving people to take accountability for their ecological footprint and engage in dialogue and resource exchange that provides real solutions to environmental challenges.



Originally published at https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/hard-rock-international-joins-world-wildlife-fund-to-go-dark-for-earth-hour-2024-302094788.html
Images courtesy of https://pixabay.com
